ms5837_ros.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 import ms5837_driver
4 
5 import rospy
6 from ms5837.msg import ms5837_data
7 from std_msgs.msg import Header
8 
9 # Choose seawater or freshwater depth calibration using ros param
10 # freshwater = 997 kg/m^3
11 # seawater = 1029 kg/m^3
12 fluidDensity = rospy.get_param('fluidDensity','997')
13 
14 def publisher():
15  #set up ros stuff
16  pub = rospy.Publisher('rov/ms5837', ms5837_data, queue_size=3)
17  rospy.init_node('ms5837')
18  rate = rospy.Rate(30) #30Hz data read
19 
20 
21  sensor = ms5837_driver.MS5837_30BA() # Default I2C bus is 1 (Raspberry Pi 3)
22  #sensor = ms5837.MS5837_02BA()
23 
24  #sensor.init must run immediatly after instatation of ms5837 object
25  attempts = 0
26  goodInit = False
27  while(goodInit != True and attempts < 10):
28  try:
29  sensor.init()
30  goodInit = True
31  except Exception as e:
32  rospy.logerr("Sensor could not be initialized! %s", e)
33  attempts += 1
34  rospy.sleep(0.25)
35 
36  if(attempts == 10):
37  rospy.logerr("Sensor could not be initialized! Program end")
38  exit(1)
39 
40  sensor.setFluidDensity(int(fluidDensity))
41 
42  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
43  msg = ms5837_data()
44  header = Header()
45 
46  goodRead = False
47  while(goodRead != True):
48  try:
49  sensor.read()
50  goodRead = True
51  except Exception as e:
52  rospy.logerr("Sensor read failed! %s", e)
53  rospy.sleep(0.2)
54 
55  msg.tempC = sensor.temperature(ms5837_driver.UNITS_Centigrade)
56  msg.tempF = sensor.temperature(ms5837_driver.UNITS_Farenheit)
57  msg.depth = sensor.depth()
58  msg.altitudeM = sensor.altitude()
59 
60  #update message headers
61  header.stamp = rospy.Time.now()
62  header.frame_id = 'depth_data'
63  msg.header = header
64 
65  pub.publish(msg)
66 
67  rate.sleep()
68 
69 if __name__ == '__main__':
70  try:
71  publisher()
72  except rospy.ROSInterruptException:
73  pass
